attributes.comment:
Passage of this legislation will effect every American citizen that is adopting a
baby from a foreign country. The increased fees can be tolerated if the service
times for processing are decreased and length of time on the approval can be
increased. The time adpotive parents spend waiting for the I600/I600-A to be
approved can be months. This is reflected in USCIS documentation that the
average processing time is 3.83 months. This is almost 4 months added to the
already agonizing wait times associated with international adoption. The approved
paperwork is only valid for 18 months. In many cases this length of time is not
sufficient for the family to complete the adoption. In many cases the families are
then put back into the position of re-filing the I600/I600-A and once again paying
the fees and once again waiting for approval. As an adoptive mother I speak from
the heart and the wallet when I say this needs to be addressed. If fees must be
raised please also consider extending the length of time that the approval is valid
to 24 months. This would ease the mental and financial burden of the family and
reduce the need for USCIS to process a family multiple times.
Thank you for your time,
Lisa Shulin

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lisa P. Shulin
